alert.note: Alert for Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 10:39PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rock Island, northwestern Whiteside, northeastern Scott and southeastern Clinton Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1039 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near DeWitt, or 12 miles west of Clinton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Low Moor around 1050 PM CDT. Camanche around 1055 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Albany, Clinton, Fulton and East Clinton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa.
